data.title: GreenPill Ottawa x Rooted LABs: Climate, Agriculture, Open Source Tooling

data.description:
Creating open-source urban-focused agriculture solutions that support the environment while feeding our communities.

​​Rooted LABs is dedicated to tackling the urgent issues of food insecurity and climate change, advocating for innovative and inclusive solutions that unite technology and communities, break down resource barriers, and promote open-source principles to enhance global agriculture.

The problem:

The world’s population has more than doubled over the past 50 years. This alone has caused immense stress on the natural environment and as a result, we are experiencing soil degradation, depletions of groundwater, pollution, ocean acidification, accelerated rates of extinction, global warming, droughts, diseases, high concentrations of CO 2 and mass deforestation. In a time of increasing population growth, climate change and environmental degradation, we need agricultural systems that come with a more balanced portfolio of sustainability benefits. 

![meme](https://www.sciline.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/AdobeStock_212840924-2000x1333.jpg)

A path forward : 

Urban agriculture has been defined as “reconnecting with the community through food, jobs and economic development” and is a sustainable solution. 

We’re testing technology, creating and maintaining urban farms starting in Ottawa, Canada's capital city, donating fresh produce to community centers, and reshaping the way we approach environmentally friendly food production while also mentoring the next generation of leaders. 

The project would be entirely open-sourced, and start a workforce who could move on and create their own advanced agricultural businesses in other cities globally.

![meme](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/6348395313c2ab7c10565062/1666116297254-R8BWBPKAP2LO5KGQT6BB/Growcer+-+ASG+Branding+-+April+2021-1.jpg?format=2500w)

What does this look like? Our Vision and Objectives:

Develop a Sustainable and Technologically Advanced Urban Farm:

- Action: Acquire a disused shipping container in downtown Ottawa and partner with The Growcer (https://www.thegrowcer.ca) to repurpose it as a smart urban farm.

- Action: Collaborate with technology and agriculture companies specializing in urban farming, automation, and renewable energy solutions to equip the shipping container with the latest sustainable farming technologies, such as hydroponics, LED lighting, and efficient climate control systems.

- Action: Create a rooftop garden in the downtown core. This not only produces fresh food but can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and support our city in hitting its climate action goals.  

- Outcome: The repurposed shipping container in downtown Ottawa becomes a state-of-the-art urban farm, producing a variety of fresh produce year-round and serving as a model for sustainable urban agriculture.

![meme](https://santropolroulant.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/rooftop-800x400.jpg)

Who we are:

Our project lead is Amanda Goore, who has a background in horticulture, community gardens and agriculture-focused AI and innovative tech and she’s bringing those skills and resources into Rooted LABs. 

With deep connections in Canada's Capital, we will use our funding to build out ways to improve access to safe and healthy food in urban settings. Our goal is to experiment and document how using emerging technology can assist us in doing this. We will then opensource our findings to help other communities globally repeat the process in their local area.

Here is a brief history of Amanda’s past work:

- developed protocol for scouting with drone multispectral mapping
- experience developing multispectral imagery of agricultural fields with different vegetative indexes
- developed algorithms for AI weed detection
- currently collaborating on disease detection and plant counting algorithms
- greenhouse and greenwall experience, hydroponics, biological control and pesticide management
- experience in autonomous robotics and vehicles
- volunteer at a local community garden
- did a project in 2019 on food security in Ottawa, gave Free Vegetable gardening workshops at the community center in Vanier, free plants and seeds for attendees.

Our other team members include:

- Olga Koppel, A PhD Candidate in Biology at the University of Ottawa is experienced in Statistical analysis and spatial modeling. You can learn more about some of her work here - ​​https://ehub-uottawa.medium.com/founder-feature-ecosafesense-412d7afe7487 

- Michael Seer, who has a background in creative design and Geospatial AI technologies

 - Lana Dingwall who is a social impact entrepreneur and member of GreenPill

This started out as a project idea within the Ottawa GreenPill chapter (we met at a web3 education workshop hosted by GPN Ottawa).

This project falls under the umbrella of Ottawa GreenPill, however, we've chosen the name Rooted LABs to help us work closer with our local municipality and provincial government, as well as Tech companies in our community.

In the last few months, we at Rooted LABs have...

- donated to Ecology Ottawa, a local tree-planting organization.

- Hosted 2 climate-focused regenerative workshops.

- Researched and built out the following Roof Top/urban garden roadmap - https://bafybeielssaoda27edlmvilepur4j3bti5xiv3ixtkkvrwlq5e44ag567i.ipfs.nftstorage.link/

- We have set up meetings with local tech and AI businesses, including Growcer(www.thegrowcer.ca) to explore collaborating on this project.

- Built out a small core team of volunteers to help grow this project. 

We are seeking funding support to help take our project from a small start-up idea, into a fast-moving open-source agricultural project.
data.title: GreenPill Ottawa x Rooted LABs: Climate, Agriculture, Open Source Tooling

data.description:
**Creating open-source urban-focused agriculture solutions that support the environment while feeding our communities.**

​​RootedLABs, working alongside the GreenPill Ottawa Chapter, is dedicated to tackling the urgent issues of food insecurity and climate change, advocating for innovative and inclusive solutions that unite technology and communities, break down resource barriers, and promote open-source principles to enhance global agriculture.

**The problem:**

The world’s population has more than doubled over the past 50 years. This alone has caused immense stress on the natural environment and as a result, we are experiencing soil degradation, depletions of groundwater, pollution, ocean acidification, accelerated rates of extinction, global warming, droughts, diseases, high concentrations of CO 2 and mass deforestation. In a time of increasing population growth, climate change and environmental degradation, we need agricultural systems that come with a more balanced portfolio of sustainability benefits.

![meme](https://i.imgur.com/6ZUOZhX.jpg)

**A path forward:**

Urban agriculture has been defined as “reconnecting with the community through food, jobs and economic development” and is a sustainable solution.

The project would be entirely open-sourced, and start a workforce who could move on and create their own advanced agricultural businesses in other cities globally.

RootedLABs is a decentralized network empowering future city farmers and urban agriculture by leveraging emerging technologies, using open-source philosophies and creating a global network of hubs (LABs) to help share resources, tools and tech to feed local communities. We establish accessible smart city farms worldwide (first location in Ottawa, Canada), fostering collaboration between academia, the tech industry, and local communities to address global agricultural challenges and support sustainable environmental practices.

![meme](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/6348395313c2ab7c10565062/1666116297254-R8BWBPKAP2LO5KGQT6BB/Growcer+-+ASG+Branding+-+April+2021-1.jpg?format=2500w)

Our focus on open-source tooling and blockchain technology allows us to facilitate connectivity between local and global agricultural needs. Leveraging decentralized physical infrastructure networks, IoT, and emerging technologies like AI and robotics, we collect data, create open datasets, code and documentation, and provide testing grounds for cutting-edge projects. 

Through educational programs and partnerships with nonprofits, schools, and governments, we promote inclusivity and sustainability while continuously innovating to address evolving technological and environmental demands.
![meme](https://i.imgur.com/Gk89eWp.jpg)
Long-term our goal is to create a global co-op (DAO) of urban farm hubs (LABs) to create a more sustainable and accessible agricultural future for the planet.  By open-sourcing all data, engineering specs, and other resources we can provide climate-saving solutions, that also feed local communities.

*we had to recreate our builder page as our previous one was on PGN

**Since  GG19 we have:**

- Hired an engineer to help build out our open-source engineering specs for our urban farm (shipping container) - these can be used by anyone wanting to open a RootedLABs in their local community, or simply want to start a farm of their own. (samples below)

- secured a partnership with AreaXO in Ottawa, an innovative agri-tech non-profit that is donating space to us for our shipping container 

- in talks with https://distributive.network/ to partner up and have them sponsor our first shipping container 

- were accepted into the AgriNEXT accelerator by Foresight Canada for Canadian AgriTech  Companies (https://foresightcac.com/agrinext-venture-application) 

- issued on-chain credentials to our founding contributors, helping set up the groundwork for our future decentralized network/DAO plans

- participating in OperationWebTree and along with GreenPill Ottawa, have purchased 160 White Pines as part of a global reforestation campaign in partnership with Silvi

- gave a presentation to Nimiq on AgriTech, RootedLABs and how we're blending AI x Crypto to tackle climate change, food insecurity and the need for more youth to enter agriculture. Looking to potentially partner with them in some way. 

- wrote a paper 'Future Global Food Demand and Population at Risk of Hunger
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CD3ZA_n4GIwgxGvuJTQ5dh76HWK8Uf8fZXrnHxW5BLg/edit?usp=sharing

- Published The OttawaLABs outline + phases (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IgpzybwzB8wW0pi-lboIhmwK8rqNc0E6DMuWEsnuR80/edit?usp=sharing)

![meme](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GFyETkcX0AA5RyK?format=jpg&name=medium)

![meme](https://i.imgur.com/dd2GrsB.jpeg)

![meme](https://i.imgur.com/oXD98QZ.jpeg)


You can find out more about what we are up to, or read our docs here:

- Our Ottawa LABs engineering specs - (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1cVIISyPKNagTBjjO19he_xj3Xo-zjR7M6PSwgWZYoLE/edit)


- A link to a presentation we gave to Nimiq a couple of weeks ago on RootedLABs and DePIN networks - (https://www.canva.com/design/DAF8I4kz370/Kr666wfHN_BTHr9VkfSW0g/view?utm_content=DAF8I4kz370&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=editor)

- wrote a paper 'Future Global Food Demand and Population at Risk of Hunger
Written by Amanda Gloor - RootedLABs' 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CD3ZA_n4GIwgxGvuJTQ5dh76HWK8Uf8fZXrnHxW5BLg/edit?usp=sharing

- Published The OttawaLABs outline + phases - (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IgpzybwzB8wW0pi-lboIhmwK8rqNc0E6DMuWEsnuR80/edit?usp=sharing)

**We are a project being incubated by GreenPill Ottawa**

data.title: GreenPill Ottawa x RootedLABs : Climate, Agriculture, Open Source Tooling
GreenPill Ottawa
data.description:
🌱 Turning regen philosophy into real-world action one person at a time 🌱 🔗powered by crypto, inspired by human potential 🌎

Based in Ottawa, Canada, we've already achieved many things, including hosting educational workshops, creating a 'getting started in web3' guide, hosting community meetups, partnering with other web3 protocols to support local impact and donating to local causes.

Our upcoming plans involve continuing to run meetups, and workshops, and collaborate with local web3 groups. We are seeking funding to sustain our chapter's growth and support the larger GPN ecosystem.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GQM4s9qWoAMf_CM?format=jpg&name=large)

Since GG20, we have:

- alongside OperationWebTree, we purchased 160 white pine seedlings and coordinated with 8+ community partners to help with reforestation in our region.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GM4-LhUW8AA9SZG?format=jpg&name=large) 
![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GM4-M5RW8AADSLN?format=jpg&name=large)

- We co-hosted an artist onboarding event with Eepvers where we lead the onboarding workshop. We gave out .0015 eth to all who created their first wallet so that they could explore onchain.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GQM4h6rWcAADZmU?format=jpg&name=large)

In the last year we have:

hosted a regenerative crypto + greenpill presentation with the Nimiq Community (https://www.nimiq.com/) exploring DePIN, how web3 tools can help foster decentralized collectives, support local communities and more.

was a community partner and speaker at Innovator and Creative Social - discussed the power of crypto in coordination, the GreenPill Network, gitcoin and other regen web3 tooling (https://lu.ma/InnovatorCreativeSocial-Denver2024)

Partnering with Silvi for #OperationWebTree (reforestation project) to grow and plant White Pines in the Ottawa region (https://x.com/greenpillottawa/status/1760784630628692049?s=20)

Donated to web3 communities:

Impact Summit (Nigeria)

Japan earthquake relief

Denver GP summit

Donated to local non-profits:

ecology Ottawa

Parkdale Food Market x2

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GBqPMxKWYAEdENV?format=jpg&name=medium)

Continued to incubate RootedLABs + bring web3 tooling into the project

⁃    Urban (Shipping container) engineering specs complete for unit 1 - to be minted on-chain

⁃    Founding member nfts distributed

⁃    Will be distributing on-chain credentials to students who help

To date we have also accomplished the following:

- Hosted educational workshops and events, helping first-time web3 users earn their first bit of crypto for successfully setting up their EVM wallets and learning how to use them.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F3gEi1sWUAEpH8s?format=jpg&name=large)

- Developed a comprehensive 'getting started in web3' guide and resource booklet, offering step-by-step instructions to assist individuals in securely establishing, funding, and using their wallets to explore web3. Most attendees were artists and public goods-focused individuals.

- Donated to Ecology Ottawa, which supports tree-planting initiatives in the city.

- Wrote the 'Touch Grass' guide for V2 GreenPill.

- Collaborated with PizzaDAO to organize an in-person Ottawa Bitcoin pizza day, providing practical demonstrations of DAO functionality and organization (attended by over 150 people).

- Co-hosted an official side event for EthWaterloo with PizzaDAO, where more than 150 participants networked around the theme of Public Goods, while also mentoring 5 hackers during the hackathon.

- Hosted an introductory workshop on decentralized social media, led by our Chapter Lead.

- Ran an intro into defi and web3 workshop at : https://growthweeklive.com/growth-week-2021 (https://growthweeklive.com/growth-week-2021)

- Are incubating RootedLABs to help spearhead the establishment of a network of decentralized Urban Farms and agriculture AI solutions (since July '23)

These accomplishments showcase our dedication to community-building, education and onboarding within web3, as well as our focus on making a positive impact in our local community..
data.problem: Most people still view crypto as a net negative and don't understand how it can help build sustainable, regenerative systems and tools for everyone,regardless of what industry or field you're in.
data.solution: We host workshops and onboard individuals and organizations to help demystify crypto by setting up their first wallet, sending them a little bit of eth to explore on chain etc. We run local impact initiatives such as tree planting, supporting our local food banks, and donating to local causes.
data.missionSummary: As a GreenPill Network chapter, we are working to ***show*** people how crypto can be used to help regenerate the world.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.title: GG19 - Climate Solutions
data.description: We are participating in Gitcoin Round 19 (GG19).

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.title: Climate Solutions Round
data.description: Climate Solutions Round Eligibility - For projects primarily focused on climate solutions. The proposal should explicitly outline how this project will help reduce GHGs or is an important core infrastructure for web3 climate solutions. Applications submitted by November 8th are guaranteed to be reviewed before the start of the round.

data.title: Glo Dollar x Arbitrum DAO
data.description: We’re rallying all Web3 projects to start embedding philanthropy in their organization by integrating the Glo Dollar stablecoin in their platform and/or treasury. By doing so these organizations bring three benefits to the world: (1) directly contribute to funding basic incomes for people in extreme poverty, (2) spread the word about Glo Dollar to a bigger audience, indirectly growing basic income funding, and (3) opportunity to join the Glo Consortium to further collaborate on reducing extreme poverty. Glo Dollar is collaborating with Arbitrum DAO to bring a total of $10,000 in USDGLO in matching for organizations that embed philanthropy. Whether you're already part of the Glo Consortium or looking to dive into Glo, this round is for you.

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation:
- we have partnered with OperationWebTree, which uses Silvi protocol on Celo to help us track our urban reforestation campaign 
- we have talked about and introduced Celo in our onboarding workshops that focus on regenerative crypto

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: We have updated our application to include these, but since our last grant round we purchased and planted 160 white pines across Ottawa, ran an onboarding workshop with 30+ attendees and helped bring them onchain by setting up wallets and giving them .0015 eth to explore and mint things. We also helped co-host Ottawa Bitcoin Pizza Day. We issued onchain proof of attendance badges to attendees of all our workshops - https://opensea.io/collection/greenpill-ottawa-event-attendee . We ran an into to ReFi workshop and We also have helped incubate RootedLABs which set up a distributed compute system that recycles heat into greenhouses

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation: Yes we participated in the Octant x GreenPill round, and our chapter steward Lana, was the round operator for this round. https://reportcards.gitcoin.co/10/0xe9459565709c5e856ffbc3cc8715824945d92de7

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Octant has been a community we bring up at workshops to help showcase how the ecosystem as a whole is focused on funding public goods. Our chapter steward and members have also supported in running Octant contests on Farcaster.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We focus on education and onboarding in general and have helped bring people into the Octant ecosystem and will continue to do so. This includes showing people how Octant works, how to stake their GLM and more.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Ottawa GreenPill and its community members would love to continue to support and run campaigns with Octant. 

This can include education and bringing qualified folks into the Octant ecosystem via GLM, staking and ensuring folks vote in the epoch rounds. 

We also will continue to support and encourage projects to apply to Octant rounds, and would love to even run a round with Octant again. 

We will also highlight Octant in our next workshop, and use some of our funds to help onboard folks. (we used funds from the Octant x GP round to distribute eth to folks being onboarded at our last workshop)

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation:
Our chapter steward Lana and contributor Kate, are dedicated Octant community members already who are actively running Octant growth campaigns on Farcaster. 

Other Ottawa community member Tay and co-organizer of Bitcoin Pizza Day,  is a longterm Pizza DAO member who has helped onboard and bring more people into the Octant Community.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: We're on the same team, trying to support public goods and have a tangible impact.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation: We are team players who often partner with other communities to run events, give talks, host spaces etc.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: We will use it to continue to onboard people, host workshops, donate to local causes/charities and support our contributor's efforts.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation:
https://mirror.xyz/kateg.eth/06OJF_GWVbmJfKAv2oQVFcaWlRHYfXuuKEIhS4baUQE

Kate is a contributor/member of GP Ottawa

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
We have already purchased 500 white pine saplings and will work with 15+ community partners to plant them throughout the Ottawa-Gatineau region.

 We will be using Silvi Protocol on Celo and will, therefore, help onboard new users, show them how to set up their wallets, and start tracking their tree planting/tree maturation growth. We'll also host workshops and tutorials for our community partners. 

We are also going to commit a portion of the USDGLO received from this round to planting commitment pools on Silvi. The goal is to use these funds to reward the white pine tree planters to update their progress and continue to use their wallets and Silvi as an app. 

We are co-hosting and sponsoring Ottawa Bitcoin Pizza Day for the 3rd year in a row.

We are continuing to work with Regeneration Canada to help bring aspects of their work on-chain and help them find ways to integrate blockchain/crypto.  

We are a part of the GreenPill Genesis staking squad and will work with other Ottawa community members to set up and be a part of the GPN staking squad. 

One of our goals this year is to use a portion of our treasury in DeFi lending pools to then use the yield earned to donate to local charities and organizations. Our goal at the end of the year is to write a recap report on how the community can use DeFi to fund their causes without touching their principal.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
